place.name: HALSTEAD
place.gazetteerText: HALSTEAD, a village and a parish in Sevenoaks district, Kent. The village stands 3 miles W of Shoreham r. station, and 6 NNW of Sevenoaks; and has a post office under Sevenoaks. The parish comprises 918 acres. Real property, £, 630. Pop., 323. Houses, 62. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Canterbury. Value, £200.* Patron, the Archbishop of Canterbury. The church is partly ancient; consists of nave, chancel, and N aisle or chapel, with tower and spire; and contains a piscina. There is a free school. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
